page.title: 19BELSIZE VILLAGE.
page.content: The main feature of Belsize,now that all the shops have disappeared is the pub.The pub has always had a great significance since it was built,to the extent that the locals did not call the village by its proper name but insisted on calling it 'The Plough'. Although the village has no shops mobile shops and library do visit the village. Many of the farms are run as they always have been,although Ollieberrie Farm,has been converted from three small farm cottages into a large private house. During the Second World War,the German's were given false information about where their V.1.flying bombs were landing,so they increased the range. Becuase of this two flying bombs came down close to Belsize,but did no damage.
